question: 付く
sourceAnswer: to:{be-attached/be-connected-with/adhere/stick/cling} | to:{remain-imprinted/scar/stain/dye} | to:bear-(fruit,-interest,-etc.) | to:{be-acquired-(of-a-habit,-ability,-etc.)/increase-(of-strength,-etc.)} | to:take-root | to:{accompany/attend/follow/study-with} | to:{side-with/belong-to} | to:{possess/haunt} | to-be:{lit/lighted} | to-be:{settled/resolved/decided} | to-be:given-(of-a-name,-price,-etc.) | to-be:{sensed/perceived} | to-be:lucky | to{?}become-(a-state,-condition,-etc.)
userAnswer: to: be:{attached/connected | imprinted | aquired | lit/turned-on | settled} | bear-fruit | take-root | accompany | side-with | possess...
activeAnswer: to: be:{attached/connected | imprinted | aquired | lit/turned-on | settled} | bear-fruit | take-root | accompany | side-with | possess...
userExplanation:
to be(come) attached/connected/adhering/sticking
interpreted very broadly and abstractly
sourceMnemonic: You know that the word <ja>付ける</ja> means "to attach" and you know that the kanji <ja>付</ja> means <kanji>attach</kanji>. So, this word probably has something to do with attaching. This is the intransitive version, though, where something is attached (and you're not doing the attaching). You can use the <ja>く</ja> as a hint. You see something attached on the wall. You say "Coo'"
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading can be derived from <ja>付ける</ja>, a word you should have seen a few levels ago. If you know that word's reading you should be able to figure out this word's reading as well (and vice versa).
